intro: Coleosanthus lemmonii var. wootonii, commonly known as the Wooton's sedge, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It typically grows in wetland or riparian habitats, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of native ecosystems in its range.
